headline: FedEx Dataworks and ServiceNow Unite AI, Data, and Workflows to Power Supply Chains of the Future
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif. & MEMPHIS, Tenn., October 29, 2025--ServiceNow and FedEx Dataworks announced an expanded strategic collaboration to power supply chains of the future by uniting AI, data, and workflows.

headline: UPS, Postal Service to reunite for delivery of low-budget shipments
summary: UPS wants to outsource final-mile delivery of its two economy parcel services to the U.S. Post Service, which is better suited to make residential drops because of its lower cost structure. The post UPS, Postal Service to reunite for delivery of low-budget shipments appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: A Fresh Look at FedEx (FDX) Valuation as Shares Rebound and Cost Cuts Take Hold
summary: FedEx (FDX) shares have inched up about 1% over the past week, reflecting steady momentum in a transportation sector that continues to recover from recent market headwinds. Investors are watching for signals on long-term growth and profitability. See our latest analysis for FedEx. FedEx’s share price has rebounded roughly 11% in the last three months, which is a notable recovery given its year-to-date decline. However, the one-year total shareholder return remains negative. Recent momentum...

headline: Why UPS Is Increasingly Turning to Gig Drivers for Deliveries
summary: Gaurav Deshpande, a 27-year-old accounting specialist, was at home in Plainsboro, N.J., waiting for  United Parcel Service  to deliver a moisturizer he ordered online, when he saw something he wasn’t expecting.  This is part of a push by the company to reduce expenses that has involved buyouts and layoffs of 34,000 drivers and warehouse workers.  UPS—and rival  FedEx  —built their business models on having end-to-end networks, meaning their employees pick up packages from the sender, sort them and deliver them to recipients.

raw.headline: Why UPS Is Increasingly Turning to Gig Drivers for Deliveries

UPS—and rival  FedEx  —built their business models on having end-to-end networks, meaning their employees pick up packages from the sender, sort them and deliver them to recipients.

headline: United Parcel Service: Why This Turnaround Is Just Getting Started
summary: United Parcel Service (UPS) is executing a strategic shift toward higher-margin deliveries, moving away from low-profit, high-volume contracts like Amazon.

headline: What You Need To Know Ahead of FedEx's Earnings Release
summary: Freight & logistics giant FedEx is expected to announce its second-quarter results by mid-December, and analysts expect a low single-digit drop in earnings.
